content.question: Which of the following is a correctly notated natural minor scale?

choices.label: The figure presents a series of notes in bass clef. The pitches are G2, A2, B-flat 2, C3, D4, E-flat 3, F3, and G3.
The figure presents a series of notes in bass clef. The pitches are G2, A2, B-flat 2, C3, D4, E-flat 3, F-sharp 3, and G3.
The figure presents a series of notes in bass clef. The pitches are G2, A2, B-flat 2, C3, D4, E3, F-sharp 3, and G3.
The figure presents a series of notes in bass clef. The pitches are G2, A2, B2, C3, D4, E3, F3, and G3.

content.answer: The figure presents a series of notes in bass clef. The pitches are G2, A2, B-flat 2, C3, D4, E-flat 3, F3, and G3.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

topic.text: 2.1: Minor Scales - Natural, Harmonic, and Melodic

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
